cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then slowing and turning north-northeast inland over Louisiana and western Mississippi.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near lower Lafourche/Terrebonne parishes (around Port Fourchon – west of the Mississippi River delta)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Warning from east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA to the AL/FL border, including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Louisiana, Mississippi coast, and adjacent inland waterways
weather_observation.wind: Potentially catastrophic winds with sustained hurricane-force (75–110+ mph) possible Sunday into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 7–11 ft possible along the lower Mississippi River delta and nearby lakes (Pontchartrain 5–8 ft).
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated amounts to 20 inches; life-threatening flash and river flooding likely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado risk Sunday–Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents already affecting the northern Gulf Coast.
